text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 7.1.1, TE/GE Administrative Procedures and Programs, Employee Plans.
This IRM is updated throughout to make editorial changes, revise section numbers, and reﬂect current versions of annual revenue procedures and IRM procedures.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This supersedes IRM 7.1.1, dated July 12, 2021.
Tax Exempt and Government Entities Employee Plans
Table of Contents
Jurisdiction of EP Technical, Examinations, Determinations and Voluntary Compliance
Memoranda to EP Determinations, EP Examinations or EP Technical
List of Major Employee Plans Revenue Procedures Currently in Effect

) Purpose: This manual describes the administrative procedures governing rulings and agreements for employee plan matters under the jurisdiction of Director, Employee Plans (EP) of the Office of the Commissioner, Tax and Government Entities division (TE/GE). (
) Audience: The administrative guidelines in this IRM apply to EP employees EP Technical, Determinations, Voluntary Compliance and Examinations. (
) Policy Owner: Director, Employee Plans (
) Program Owner: Employee Plans (

) Program Goals: The goal of EP is to provide taxpayers top-quality service helping them understand and comply with applicable tax laws, and to protect the public interest by applying the tax law with integrity and fairness to all. Note: EP focuses on encouraging taxpayers (administrators and employers) to untarily comply with the income tax laws. To protect plan participants and retirement savings, the goal of many of the programs under the jurisdiction the Director, Employee Plans, is to avoid plan disqualiﬁcation. (
) A plan is qualiﬁed if it meets the requirements of IRC
(a) in form and operation. A qualiﬁed plan is entitled to favorable tax treatment. Other plans entitled to favorable tax treatment within EP’s jurisdiction are: • IRC
(b) plans •
(b) plans • Simpliﬁed Employee Pension plans (SEPs) • Savings Incentive Match Plans for Employees (SIMPLEs) (

) To help taxpayers understand the applicable tax laws and ensure that their plans comply, EP issues certain letter rulings, determination letters (DL), opinion letters, advisory letters and approval letters. (
) EP enters into compliance statements and closing agreements with plan sponsors to resolve failures to comply with the plan qualiﬁcation requirements, avoiding plan disqualiﬁcation. (
) EP provides technical and actuarial support to IRS employees through: • The Knowledge Networks (K-Nets) • Responses to requests for actuarial assistance (
) This IRM is an overview of the administrative procedures governing EP Rulings and Agreements. EP Rulings and Agreements is made up of: • EP Technical • Voluntary Compliance • Determinations (
) This IRM covers the following topics: a. IRM
, Program Scope and Objectives provides an overview of Rulings and Agreements programs. b. IRM
, Jurisdiction of EP Technical, Examinations, Determinations and Voluntary Compliance, lists speciﬁc EP programs; for example, Plans

7.1 TE/GE Administrative Procedures and Programs
Rulings, Determination Letters (DL), Opinion Letters, and the EP office that rules on them. IRM

, Assistance to Determinations, Voluntary Compliance, and Examinations lists procedures for submitting cases for technical advice, requesting technical assistance, and issuing memoranda providing technical or procedural guidance.

Delegation Order Granted Authority Delegated to IRM Section Delegation Order 7-1 To issue favorable determina- tion letters (DLs) on the qualiﬁed status of pension, proﬁt-sharing, stock bonus, annuity, and employee stock ownership plans under IRC 401, IRC 403(a), IRC 409 and IRC 4975(e)(7); and the status for exemption of any related trusts or custodial accounts under IRC 501(a). Director, Employee Plans IRM 1.2.2.8.1 Delegation Order 7-16 To allow a plan to be amended after the expiration of its remedial amendment period described in IRC 401(b), provided that certain conditions are met. Director, EP Rulings and Agreements IRM 1.2.2.8.16 Delegation Order 7-7 To waive all or part of the excise tax imposed under IRC 4971(f) for liquidity shortfalls per IRC 412(m)(5)(E). Director, Employee Plans IRM 1.2.2.8.7 Delegation Order 7-9 To determine that a plan amendment is reasonable and provides for only de minimis increases in the plan liabilities per: IRC 412(c)(7)(B)(i), the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, (ERISA) Section 302(c)(7)(B)(i), IRC 401(a)(33)(B)(ii), and Section 204(i)(2)(A). Manager, EP Technical and Manager, EP Technical Actuarial Group IRM 1.2.2.8.9
) Administrative procedures are generally listed in revenue procedures. Revenue procedures are published in the Internal Revenue Bulletin (IRB), which is published weekly. (

, updated annually: a. Includes the procedures for requesting letter rulings, DLs and opinion letters from Employee Plans Rulings and Agreements. It also includes the user fees for these requests. b. Discusses in detail, the procedural guidance for these programs.

Rev. Proc. 2022-4, Section 31 lists the mailing addresses for requesting letter rulings, determination letters, etc.
“letter ruling” is a written statement IRS issued to a taxpayer that interprets applies the employee beneﬁt plans laws to a speciﬁc set of facts.

a. IRS only issues a DL when based on clearly established rules in the statute, a tax treaty, regulations, or based on a conclusion in a revenue ruling, opinion, or court decision representing the IRS’s position, and that speciﬁcally answers the questions presented. b. IRS doesn’t issue a DL for novel issues or issues excluded from EP De- terminations jurisdiction. (

) A “compliance statement” is a binding written agreement between EP Rulings and Agreements and, generally, the plan sponsor. It describes certain failures of the retirement plan to meet the applicable requirements under IRC
(a), IRC
(b), IRC
(k) or IRC
(p). See Rev. Proc.
and IRM TE/GE Closing Agreements, Employee Plans Compliance Resolution System (EPCRS). Agreements (
) A “closing agreement” is a ﬁnal agreement between the IRS and a taxpayer a speciﬁc issue or liability per IRC
See IRM

, TE/GE Closing Agreements, Employee Plans Compliance Resolution System (EPCRS). (

) EP employees don’t issue oral rulings or determinations, letter rulings or DLs in response to oral requests from taxpayers. Instead, EP employees generally discuss with taxpayers or their authorized representatives EP’s jurisdiction to rule on particular issues and the procedural requirements to submit DL or ruling requests. (

) In EP’s discretion, EP employees may also discuss substantive issues with taxpayers or their representatives. Taxpayers can’t rely on oral advice as a basis for obtaining retroactive relief under Code section
(b). (Rev. Proc.
, Section

) The Office of the Director, EP Examinations, investigates approved NBTs for continued compliance, then reports its ﬁndings to the Director, Employee Plans. to EP Examinations and EP and Agreements (

) The Associate Chief Counsel (Employee Beneﬁts, Exempt Organizations and Employment Taxes) (EEE) and the Tax Exempt and Government Entities Division Counsel (TEGEDC) provide technical and legal support to EP Exami- nations and EP Rulings and Agreements. The support may be written or oral. (
) Their written advice may be presented as technical advice, technical assis- tance or other memoranda, depending on the nature of the matter. See Rev. Proc.

for the administrative authority for requesting technical advice. EEE and TEGEDC offer assistance for: a. EP Rulings and Agreements and EP Examinations, who may request may be required to request) help on a technical issue raised during a private letter ruling request, DL request, an examination, or a request under VCP. EEE and TEGEDC provide assistance in the form of technical advice or technical assistance. b. Advice due to the passage of new legislation for which there is no published precedent. They provide advice in the form of a memorandum to an EP Examinations Area manager, EP Technical manager, or EP terminations Area manager. Advice (

) “Technical advice” means EEE’s advice or guidance via a memorandum that: a. EP Examinations or EP Rulings and Agreements requests, or b. In response to a technical or procedural question that develops during determination or examination on the interpretation and proper application of tax law, tax treaties, regulations, revenue rulings, notices or other edents published by IRS to a speciﬁc set of facts. (
) For additional guidance on requesting technical advice, see: a. Rev. Proc.
b. IRM
, Employee Plans Determinations Letter Program, Preparing Technical Advice Requests. c. IRM
, Employee Plans Examination of Returns, Technical Assis- tance and Technical Advice Requests and Requests for Relief under section
(b). Assistance (

) Technical assistance covers matters of general technical application in EP Rulings and Agreements, EP Examinations or an Appeals Office, where the issues: a. Aren’t raised in an examination of a taxpayer’s return or a request for determination letter. b. Don’t relate to a speciﬁc case under consideration by EP Rulings and Agreements, EP Examinations or an Appeals Office. (
) EP Technical issues technical assistance, when appropriate to the relevant questing office. (
) The K-Nets also offer technical assistance to IRS employees. See IRM
, Resource Guide for Managers, TE/GE K-Net Administration.

) Memoranda to EP Determinations, EP Examinations or EP (

) Memoranda containing either technical or procedural guidance may be issued to EP Technical, EP Determinations, EP Examinations or Voluntary Compli- ance. The guidance may be provided on matters of policy, new legislation or IRS positions. Where appropriate, the instructions contained in the memoranda are incorporated into the IRMs.
